caption: A great place to watch sports events or concerts. The scene is customized for each artist's preference. The entrance is very organized. I would recommend to buy VIP tickets or to bring an american express card to skip the line that can be very long. If you don't have any of those things, come about an hour early.

Great arena! The seats were spacious, the technology for lighting, screens etc was fab. I don't remember seeing many food options around but I wasn't looking for them either. Didn't use the toilets but the rest of the arena was clean

Incredible venue for the Paris Masters. Food and drink options were varied and nice, nothing out of this world but good enough for snacking and having small meals. The reason I gave it a 4 over a 5 was the fact that Courts 1 and 2 had no toilet facilities meaning you needed to go back to the main area to visit the bathroom and you would in turn have to queue again most likely losing your seat. Other than that inconvenience, it's a truly sensational venue for tennis.
The room is huge and the sound for concerts is incredible. The line is veeeeery long but when the doors open it's very fast. Inside, it feels like an airport, with food and shops. Crazy.

Gloves are mandatory for ice skating here. Nice place for ice skating. No visitors allowed. You will have to pay to enter even if you dont plan to skate. You can keep your bag in a paid locker. There are toilets. No safety gear provided, if you fall its on you!
This is a beautiful Arena from outside and pretty inside. Well designed for easy access and quick exit. At least for the Olympics all was well.

Went for a concert and found it to be pretty decent. Easy to get in with good crowd control through security. Plenty of staff guiding you in. A selection of food and drink kiosk inside. The seating wasn't too uncomfortable, although I was stool while the show took place.  Finding the seat was a little confusing (specifically working out which doors/stairs to use) but there was signage. Could maybe have benefited from extra signage on the wall at the front of the balcony guiding which sides are for which seat numbers.

What a perfect Arena for the Olympic Gymnastics! Epic results for my former gymnast! Watching with a current gymnast made it even more special! Loved the souvenir cup as well as the normal arena food!! #hopswiss

Saw Madonna here in Novembre. Such a great setting. The concessions moved very quickly and was very reasonably priced (I‚Äôm from New York so not paying $20 for a bottle of water or one beer was nice). üíØ ‚Ä¶

An embarrassing display of mismanagement. On a visit to see the cirque du soleil we were told our booked dream middle-of-the-arena seats no longer existed and were moved. I don't care about a little mixup but we were moved to a corner at the front, view blocked by ugly railing directly Infront of us.  Upon contacting the manager about our paid seats being changed so drastically, he proved incompetent and completely unsympathetic. All together an unpleasant and disappointing experience that left me and my partner fuming and spoiled our mood for the show completely. At such a steeply priced ticket (not even mentioning food and drink) I expected at least some professional resolution but we were shooed away. Never coming back. Can't recommend. Don't waste money here.

Huge stadium great for watching the tennis and the lighting technology is amazing. Near the front so had 70 steps each time to get to our seats which were comfortable! The food options are quite limited with mainly fast food no salads and no wine. Restaurant closes between lunch and early evening! Toilets ok. Access was quick and easy, well resourced and helpful. The atmosphere was well regulated and quite pleasant.

Very beautiful at this arena. I have not found anywhere as beautiful landscapes as in Paris. Paris is the most beautiful and cleanest city in Europe!!! I'M JOKING!!! I haven't found any city in all of Europe miserable  than Paris!!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!!!
Awesome venue for a concert. The only negative is people were smoking in there.
Great place. Security takes longer than you think though!!  This video is from the last row at the stadium, and the view is still great :)

I came here for one of Madonna's shows in November 2023 and I found this venue to be good. The entrances were well marked, the restrooms were "clean" (all things considered), and everything was pretty much as you would expect for an arena. One of the best things about this place is its convenient location. It's walking distance from Gare de Lyon and right next to Gare de Bercy.
A stunning arena for concerts and sporting events. We watched Paralympic basketball and the view from anywhere in the arena was magnificent and the atmosphere electric.

I went to the Accor Arena to see Bring Me The Horizon. It was incredible. The venue is well organized, easy to get to and super clean. They have more than enough food, bathrooms and the sound is great.  I was super impressed and loved every minute of it.

I came to see Nicki minaj perform at this arena ! It was great ! The security was a little behind on opening the show but once the doors opened the setup was very nice ! They even served us refreshments with drinks were also included as apart of the Nicki Minaj VIP package . They were very secure and made sure they checked everyone tickets and IDs . The arena itself was huge ! Lots of space & comfortable seating . Would defly attend another show there again !

Super impressed with this venue! Came to town on vacation and purchased some Sza concert tickets. The Venue was well organized and staff was quick to put people on check! Made the event very safe and pleasant. In the US you always smell weed in the entire damn stadium but in Paris that shit must not be tolerated because it was a very clean atmosphere! A super plus!! Thank you Accor Arena for a great event!!

The best concert organization ever. We have attended three times and each time no disorganized crowds, no rush, no ‚Äúmarathon‚Äù to the first line. People are well-managed and what‚Äôs is the best part - after the performance it takes 10-15 minutes max to go outside while other stadiums are total mess, you need at least 30 min to exit from there. Love Accor Arena so much!

The organisation inside was great, but outside not so much. The fosse queue to "Cigarettes after sex" concert was insane üòÖ There should have been more staff to scan tickets, or at least the company could have informed to arrive 2 hours before the event ‚Ä¶
Andr√© Rieu‚ù§Ô∏è Amazing concert! Live emotions, happy moments, a lot of laughter and joy, dance, and sing a beautiful songs‚Ä¶ Definitely must go performanceüëèüëèüëè ‚Ä¶

The Arena was fine, but the catering was a joke. 7 euros for a soaked piece of bread and a sausage, they were out of Burgers after 10 minutes. The "Hotdog" came without fried onions or pickles. Mustars was also missing.

I came for Sam Smith's concert.  A huge place with professional arrangement by the staff (the bad thing is we bought the Fosse Debout ticket and it was located at a different gate (because they were under repair we were very confused as to which way to go)  anyway..) But after that, everything was fine. Their stage was well invested with high-end led lighting system and full HD screen. We had a memorable experience. Plus, it was very good.  It's close to the metro so it's very convenient to move around.

The Accor Arena is an amazing venue.  I‚Äôve been here twice now for Sam Smith and Lizzo and couldn‚Äôt be more impressed with how the evenings were organised.  We were escorted to our seats on a personal basis both times, which was a lovely touch and saved a lot of time. The venue is intimate (so we had a great view!) but the energy is definitely still there.  Fabulous!
It was so fun! Went for the concert de La Piece Jaune. The staff is so nice. The security guards were helping those who fainted. The seats are good, and the stage is nice.
It‚Äôs was great went to france v Canada at the olimpics and it was unforgettable

Went to see Madonna there. Sold out but no waiting times for drinks etc. fantastic venue with great restaurants around it for a quick dinner before the show. Obviously easily reached by Metro üöã ‚Ä¶

Dead cute little arena. Easily accessible by metro from all over Paris. Staff are friendly and has loads of quality food and drink stalls on the concourse. Exterior is an absolutely gorgeous and unique design. Thanks for making the last major special.
A bit disorganised to get in, but as soon you get in, it is great . Metro just outside the Arena  and very crowded after the concert. Would /will go back again

I visited the Accor Arena on November 30th for the final Shaka Ponk show. I was impressed. Most of the staff, from security to doors to concessions, was friendly and helpful (the doorman to the section I was sitting in was kind of a numpty jerk, but one grumpy apple among hundreds doesn't spoil the bunch here). The interior was well layed-out an easy to navigate, with facilities plentiful throughout. The seats were surprisingly comfortable, and the view to the stage even from over three-quarters back was good. My experience with Accor is night and day compared with the Paris La D√®fense Arena (where I also attended a concert the same week; La D√®fense is a horrid arena), and going forward, I absolutely would not hesitate to attend another show at the Accor Arena.

I saw the one and only Queen, aka Nicki Minaj ! Very nice Avenue with very lovely staff at the entrance. Security was very lovely with the public and was providing water in case someone wasn't feeling good. Thank you Accor Arena for this opportunity!
I was there to participate at BPI France BIG Event in October 5th. I loved the ambience by itself, lighting, sound system, and the area was great.

Nice arena. Please note that bags larger than 10 liters is forced to be stored at manned lockers with low service. No seats on toilets, neither on men and women‚Äôs.. Ok prices for beverages. Low quality food.
Great place , nice venue for shows

Perfect. We went to the Panic! At the disco and Fletcher concert and it was such a beautiful moment.  The entrance to the track or numbered seats is different, but there are people who work there to signal you where you should move. The downside is that the drinks are quite expensive (a water ‚Ç¨3.75, a Coke ‚Ç¨4, a cocktail ‚Ç¨14...)
I went to the UFC fight night Paris in the Accor Arena it was an incredible experience

So yeah, based on what 2 people reviewing everyone going up the stairs pre-event, you are taken out of line and guided to the consignes to leave your backpack (2 Euro, not a big deal). When I was made to drop mine off there were 2 other guys that just walked through with theirs. Took me 45m in a huge line to drop it off, since only 3 people were checking bags for a 8k people gym. After the game we stood in line almost 2 hours to get our backpack, because the understaffed consignes desk was making a mess of everything and the security (which was way too few and quite ill-prepared) just allowed multiple lines to be formed and whilst fair people waited almost 2 hrs, others that waited 10m but cut in line got their bag. Got home at 2:30 am. Too bad ...
